choices.answer: A need is something that your survival may depend on.
Food could be considered to be either a need or a want.
A want is something that is bad to have.
What may be a need to someone may be a want to others.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about needs and wants is FALSE?

choices.answer: insect repellent
water
your mobile phone
instant noodles

questions.question: You are going on a full day hike through Bukit Timah Nature Reserve. You do not need to bring:
A budget plan is necessary so that:

choices.answer: I will have enough money to set aside for emergencies.
I can ensure that money is spent on what I need most.
I will be able to avoid impulse buying.
All of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about budgeting is TRUE?

choices.answer: Sources of income include allowance, salary and cash gifts.
You overspend when your total income exceeds total expenses.
It is ok to overspend once in a while.
A budget plan must be set on a weekly basis.
You will be more prepared for emergencies.
You will be less self-reliant.
You will have more choices when getting what you want.
You will have the opportunity to help others financially.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an advantage of having savings?

choices.answer: Independence
Willingness to take risks

questions.question: T or F: An investment is when you put money, effort or time into something for one's benefit.

choices.answer: TRUE
FALSE

questions.question: Why can education be considered an investment?

choices.answer: Education enables you to acquire new knowledge.
Education helps increase your earning power.
You have more job opportunities with a better education.
All of the above.

questions.question: A smart shopper would NOT have this question in mind before buying something:

choices.answer: Do all my friends also have the product?
Do other shops also carry this product?
Do I really need this product?
Will the price of this product be lower during a sale?

Relationships with friends and family hurt
Working beyond one's retirement years

choices.answer: Education

questions.question: Which of the following areas does Singapore's government spend the most on?

choices.answer: Taxes

questions.question: The following are sources of government revenue except:

choices.answer: Many years of budget deficit will lead to debt.

Governments can pay debts by lowering taxes.
